tool.name: AccurateMassSearch
tool.description: Find potential HMDB ids within the given mass error window.
tool.command:
AccurateMassSearch
#if $param_in: -in $param_in #end if #if $param_out: -out $param_out #end if #if $param_out_annotation: -out_annotation $param_out_annotation #end if #if $param_positive_adducts_file: -positive_adducts_file $param_positive_adducts_file #end if #if $param_negative_adducts_file: -negative_adducts_file $param_negative_adducts_file #end if -db:mapping #for token in $param_db_mapping: $token #end for -db:struct #for token in $param_db_struct: $token #end for #if $param_algorithm_mass_error_value: -algorithm:mass_error_value $param_algorithm_mass_error_value #end if #if $param_algorithm_mass_error_unit: -algorithm:mass_error_unit $param_algorithm_mass_error_unit #end if #if $param_algorithm_ionization_mode: -algorithm:ionization_mode $param_algorithm_ionization_mode #end if #if $param_algorithm_isotopic_similarity: -algorithm:isotopic_similarity #end if #if $param_algorithm_keep_unidentified_masses: -algorithm:keep_unidentified_masses #end if #if $param_algorithm_mzTab_exportIsotopeIntensities: -algorithm:mzTab:exportIsotopeIntensities $param_algorithm_mzTab_exportIsotopeIntensities #end if #if $adv_opts.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts.param_force: -force #end if #end if

param.name: param_positive_adducts_file
param.label: This file contains the list of potential positive adducts that will be looked for in the database
param.help: (-positive_adducts_file) Edit the list if you wish to exclude/include adducts. By default CHEMISTRY/PositiveAdducts.tsv in OpenMS/share is used! If empty, the default will be used

param.name: param_negative_adducts_file
param.label: This file contains the list of potential negative adducts that will be looked for in the database
param.help: (-negative_adducts_file) Edit the list if you wish to exclude/include adducts. By default CHEMISTRY/NegativeAdducts.tsv in OpenMS/share is used! If empty, the default will be used

param.name: param_db_mapping
param.label: Database input file(s), containing three tab-separated columns of mass, formula, identifie
param.help: (-mapping) If 'mass' is 0, it is re-computed from the molecular sum formula. By default CHEMISTRY/HMDBMappingFile.tsv in OpenMS/share is used! If empty, the default will be used

param.name: param_db_struct
param.label: Database input file(s), containing four tab-separated columns of identifier, name, SMILES, INCHI.The identifier should match with mapping file
param.help: (-struct) SMILES and INCHI are reported in the output, but not used otherwise. By default CHEMISTRY/HMDB2StructMapping.tsv in OpenMS/share is used! If empty, the default will be used

param.name: param_algorithm_mass_error_value
param.label: Tolerance allowed for accurate mass search

param.name: param_algorithm_mass_error_unit
param.label: Unit of mass error (ppm or Da)

param.name: param_algorithm_ionization_mode
param.label: Positive or negative ionization mode?
param.help: (-ionization_mode) If 'auto' is used, the first feature of the input map must contain the meta-value 'scan_polarity'. If its missing, the tool will exit with error

param.name: param_algorithm_isotopic_similarity
param.label: Computes a similarity score for each hit (only if the feature exhibits at least two isotopic mass traces)

param.name: param_algorithm_keep_unidentified_masses
param.label: Keep features that did not yield any DB hit

param.name: param_algorithm_mzTab_exportIsotopeIntensities
param.label: [featureXML input only] Number of extra columns in mzTab output, which provide intensities up to the x'th isotope
param.help: (-exportIsotopeIntensities) '0' to deactivate, '1' for monoisotopic peak, etc. If a feature does not have a certain isotope, 'null' will be reported

tool.help:
Find potential HMDB ids within the given mass error window.
For more information, visit http://ftp.mi.fu-berlin.de/OpenMS/release-documentation/html/UTILS_AccurateMassSearch.html
